abstract: The Bank of England expects consumer prices, which have been stuck at a zero-percent inflation rate for two months, to pick up by the end of the year.
snippet: The Bank of England expects consumer prices, which have been stuck at a zero-percent inflation rate for two months, to pick up by the end of the year.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — The Bank of England expects British consumer prices, which have been stuck at a zero-percent inflation rate for two months, to pick up by the end of the year, as the economy gathers steam.

headline.main: Britain Trims Growth Forecast, but Signals Hope on Consumer Prices
